pageContext.claim: “You look at other countries; they don't even do tests. They do tests if somebody walks into the hospital, they're sick, they're really sick, they test them then, or they'll test them in a doctor's office. But they don't go around have massive areas of testing and we do.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Data from Johns Hopkins University suggests many countries should be testing more — including the United States— but they are testing.
